titleStmt.title: A pack of old Puritans· maintaining the unlawfulness & inexpediency of subscribing the new engagement. Professing the dissatisfaction of their judgements, and the unresolvedness of their consciences, with Mr. Jghn [sic] Dury's Considerations and just reproposals concerning it. And answering the most material allegations that are urged by him or others for subscription.

A pack of old Puritans· maintaining the unlawfulness & inexpediency of subscribing the new engagement. Professing the dissatisfaction of their judgements, and the unresolvedness of their consciences, with Mr. Jghn [sic] Dury's Considerations and just reproposals concerning it. And answering the most material allegations that are urged by him or others for subscription.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the Company of Covenant-Keepers, dwelling in Great Brittain,

notesStmt.note: A reply to "Just re-proposals to humble proposals" and "Considerations concerning the present engagement, whether it may lawfully be entered into, yea or no?", both by John Dury.
In this edition line 11 of title page ends: just.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Feb: 22 1649"; the imprint date has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
